snippet: Justice Thomas asked questions from the bench for the first time since February 2006, and just weeks after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia.
abstract: Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas breaks unprecedented 10-year silence, questioning government attorney from bench during oral arguments in gun rights case; some suggest Thomas was prompted to fill void created by recent death of his close friend Justice Antonin Scalia.
lead_paragraph: Justice Thomas asked questions from the bench for the first time since February 2006, and just weeks after the death of Justice Antonin Scalia.

headline.main: Clarence Thomas Breaks 10 Years of Silence at Supreme Court
headline.print_headline: Thomas Ends 10-Year Silence on the Bench
